title: Frontend deployment readiness status UI and Activity 2 deployment checklist

requirements.summary: Expose backend deployment/readiness status in the UI with clear English messages and recommended next actions (access control + Stripe at minimum).
acceptanceCriteria: The app shows a clear status panel/banner when critical prerequisites are not met (at minimum: access control not initialized; Stripe not configured).
The UI does not require editing any files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths.

file_operations.description: Extend the generated backend TypeScript declarations to include the new structured readiness status type and the single backend method used to query readiness (as added by REQ-2), so the frontend can call it without type errors.

Add a React Query hook (e.g., useDeploymentReadiness) that calls the backend readiness method via the actor, returns a structured readiness result, and never throws uncaught errors (surface failures as a safe UI state/message instead).

Create a non-intrusive status banner/panel component that consumes the readiness hook and renders English, user-facing diagnostics and next-action guidance (e.g., access control initialization required; Stripe configuration required). Ensure it does not depend on or modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (immutable paths).
Wire the new DeploymentReadinessBanner into the main app layout so it is visible after deploy (e.g., within Layout above the Outlet) and is not an orphan component.

requirements.summary: Add an Activity 2 step-by-step deployment checklist document to the repo (English), including readiness verification guidance before publish.
acceptanceCriteria: A new documentation file exists in the repository describing the numbered Activity 2 steps (including Step 6 deploy, Step 7 publish) and what to verify before continuing.
The checklist includes a specific instruction to verify the new readiness status before attempting publish.

file_operations.description: Add an English, numbered “Activity 2 deployment checklist” documenting the confirm-at-each-step workflow, including Step 6 deploy and Step 7 publish, explicitly warning against mid-step manual changes and instructing operators to verify the new readiness status in the app UI before attempting publish.
